clinical_study.brief_title: Six-Minute Walk Test Comparing Helium/Oxygen to Nitrogen/Oxygen for COPD Rehabilitation
clinical_study.official_title: Single Centre, Exploratory, Phase II, Cross-over, Randomised Trial, Evaluating the Effect of Spontaneously Breathing He/O2 65%/35% to Either Spontaneously Breathing N2/O2 65%35% or Non-Invasive Ventilated N2/O2 65%/35% on a 6 Minute Walk Test in Severe COPD Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate effects of inspired gas mixtures on the distance walked by patients with severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) during a Six-Minute Walk test.

detailed_description.textblock: the purpose of this study is to evaluate the distance walked by patients with severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) during a Six-Minute Walk test (6MWT) while breathing Helium/Oxygen 65%/35% compared to either breathing Nitrogen/Oxygen 65%/35% or receiving Non-Invasive Ventilation (NIV) with a FiO2 of 0.35 and to evaluate exercise related symptoms

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due to low recruitment rate the sponsor decided to discontinue the study.

primary_outcome.description: evaluate the distance walked by patients during a Six-Minute Walk Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the safety of inhalation Helium/Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate the safety of the administration of Helium/Oxygen 65%/35%

arm_group.description: Medicinal oxygen 100% via NIV with FiO2 of 0.35

intervention.description: Inhalated gas, medicinal oxygen 100% via NIV with Fi O2 0.35, one time by random, 6 minutes
Inhalated gas, Nitrogen/Oxygen (65%/35%), one time by random, 6 minutes
Inhalated gas, Helium/Oxygen (65%/35%) one time by random, 6 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female aged >= 45 and <= 75 years old
- Patient with documented clinical diagnosis of stage III/IV COPD
- Patient with stable COPD defined by no significant increase in COPD medication, no treatment for COPD in an emergency, no acute intensive care setting and no intake of antibiotics in the four weeks prior to selection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability or contra-indication to perform pulmonary function tests
- Inability or contra-indication to perform the 6MWT with a trolley
- Any contra-indication to receive NIV
- Obese patient having a Body Mass Index (BMI) > 35
- Pregnant or lactating woman
- Female or chil-bearing potential with lack of efficient contraception
